intro: Burmeistera dichlora, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs.
